==Club career== ===Early career in the Ivory Coast=== In his native Ivory Coast, the young Seri was nicknamed "Galla", because he tried to emulate the former [[AS Monaco|Monaco]] and [[Paris Saint-Germain]] midfielder [[Marcelo Gallardo]], whose technical skills he admired. Seri joined the Ivorian football academy that was opened in 2001 by the Ivorian footballer [[Cyril Domoraud]]. "Jean is gifted, intelligent and respectful," Domoraud said in retrospect. "In his young days, he was one step ahead of the others, thanks to his ball control."<ref name="JeanSeriESPN5AUg2017">{{cite news|title=Arsenal target Jean Seri destined for big move after Nice displays|url=http://www.espnfc.com/english-premier-league/23/blog/post/3172560/arsenal-target-jean-seri-in-line-for-big-move-after-nice-displays|work=ESPN|date=5 August 2017}}</ref>
Born in the south-western city of [[Grand-Béréby]], Seri began his career as a youth player with [[Abidjan]] club [[Africa Sports d'Abidjan]] in July 2007.<ref>{{cite news|title=Jean-Michaël Seri at FootballDatabase.eu|url=http://www.footballdatabase.eu/football.joueurs.jean-michael.seri.134057.fr.html|work=FootballDatabase.eu}}</ref> The best clubs in Ivory Coast fought for his services. In January 2010, Seri started his career as a senior player by joining [[ASEC Mimosas]], the most successful club in Ivorian football, where he needed just one season to prove himself and become one of the best players in the country. "He is a great listener, and his state of mind is impeccable," raved Sébastien Desabre, ASEC Mimosas's head coach from October 2010 to October 2012 when Seri was a senior player there, and that quality enabled Seri to make steady progress.<ref name="JeanSeriESPN5AUg2017"/>
===Porto=== On 2 November 2012, Seri joined [[Primeira Liga]] club [[FC Porto]] on loan, after impressing their scouts. However, there was no place for Seri in the club's first team. He was thus forced to play for the club's [[FC Porto B|reserve team]], scoring once in 19 [[2012–13 Segunda Liga|Segunda Liga]] matches in the first five months of 2013.<ref name="JeanSeriESPN5AUg2017"/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/liga-nos/fc-porto/detalhe/dragoes-garantem-jean-michael-seri-786352.html|title=Dragões garantem Jean-Michael Seri|trans-title=Dragons guarantee Jean-Michael Seri|work=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]]|date=2 November 2012|accessdate=11 March 2014}}</ref><ref name="JeanSeri at Soccerway">{{cite news|title=Jean Seri at Soccerway|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/jean-michael-seri/171726/|work=Soccerway}}</ref>
===Paços de Ferreira=== On 31 August 2013, two months after finishing his loan spell at Porto (the ''Dragões''), Seri joined another [[Primeira Liga]] club [[F.C. Paços de Ferreira|Paços de Ferreira]] on a permanent basis and on a free transfer by signing a three-year deal.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/fc-porto-jean-michel-seri-assina-pelo-p-ferreira/5221d1f984ae24c6a09fc476.html|title=FC Porto: Jean Michel Seri assina pelo P. Ferreira|trans-title=FC Porto: Jean Michel Seri signs for P. Ferreira|work=MaisFutebol|date=31 August 2013|accessdate=11 March 2014}}</ref> He debuted for the ''Pacenses'' on 14 September 2013 against [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] in a [[2013–14 Primeira Liga|Primeira Liga]] 3–1 away loss.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.zerozero.pt/jogo.php?id=2838079|title=Benfica 3–1 P. Ferreira|trans-title=|work=ZeroZero|date=14 September 2013|accessdate=11 March 2014}}</ref> On 2 March 2014, he scored a goal in the 54th minute to register his first competitive goal for Paços de Ferreira in a 3–1 Primeira Liga home win over [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]] to send his side away from the relegation zone.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.zerozero.pt/jogo.php?id=2838213|title=P. Ferreira 3–1 Marítimo|trans-title=|work=ZeroZero|date=2 March 2014|accessdate=11 March 2014}}</ref> It was at Paços de Ferreira where Seri's magnificent range of passing and ability to dictate the tempo of the game made him a fans' favourite. The club finished in eighth place in the [[2014–15 Primeira Liga]], and [[Ligue 1]] club [[OGC Nice|Nice]] were quick to sign Seri before bigger clubs took notice.<ref name="JeanSeriESPN5AUg2017"/>
===Nice=== On 11 June 2015, Seri officially joined [[Ligue 1]] club [[OGC Nice|Nice]] for a transfer fee of €1 million.<ref name="JeanSeriESPN5AUg2017"/><ref>{{cite news|title=Seri à Nice, c'est officiel|trans-title=Seri to Nice, it's official|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Seri-a-nice-c-est-officiel/565777|accessdate=19 February 2017|work=L'Equipe|date=11 June 2015|language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Jean-Michaël Seri : L’Ivoirien signe à Nice|trans-title=Jean-Michaël Seri: The Ivorian signs to Nice|url=http://www.africatopsports.com/2015/06/11/jean-michael-seri-livoirien-signe-a-nice/|website=Africa Top Sports|accessdate=19 February 2017|language=French|date=11 June 2015}}</ref> On 27 May 2015, prior to the opening of the transfer window, the club had announced the "very likely" arrival of Seri.<ref>{{cite news|title=P. Ferreira: Nice confirma contratação de Seri|trans-title=P. Ferreira: Nice confirms Seri signing|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/transferencias/pacos-ferreira/p-ferreira-nice-confirma-contratacao-de-seri|accessdate=19 February 2017|work=MaisFutebol|date=27 May 2015|language=Portuguese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Jean-Michael Seri arrive aussi|trans-title=Jean-Michael Seri also arrives|url=http://www.ogcnice.com/fr/actualite/23944/jean-michael-seri-arrive-aussi|website=OGC Nice|accessdate=19 February 2017|language=French}}</ref> On 8 August 2015, Seri made his competitive debut for Nice in their opening match of the [[2015–16 Ligue 1]] season, playing the entire match in the 2–1 home loss to [[AS Monaco|Monaco]]. On 27 September 2015, he scored in the 53rd minute to register his first competitive goal for Nice in a 4–1 Ligue 1 away win over [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]].<ref name="JeanSeri at Soccerway"/>
===Fulham=== In July 2018, Seri joined [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on a four-year deal until 2022 with an option for Fulham to extend the contract by a further year.<ref>{{cite news |title=Jean Michael Seri: Fulham sign Ivory Coast international from Nice |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44807027 |accessdate=12 July 2018 |work=BBC Sport |date=12 July 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Seri made a total of three appearances for the [[Ivory Coast national under-23 football team|Ivory Coast U-23 team]], all of them at the [[2011 CAF U-23 Championship]] held in Morocco, playing every minute of all their three Group B matches against South Africa, Egypt and Gabon. Ivory Coast finished third in Group B and thus did not qualify for the semifinals.
On 27 February 2014, Seri received his first senior international call up for the [[Ivory Coast national football team|Ivory Coast]] in an upcoming [[Exhibition game|friendly match]] against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]];<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga/pacos_ferreira/interior.aspx?content_id=870292 |title=Séri convocado para a seleção costa-marfinense |trans-title=Séri selected for the Ivorians |work=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]] |date=27 February 2014 |accessdate=11 March 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140305182620/http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga/pacos_ferreira/interior.aspx?content_id=870292 |archivedate= 5 March 2014 |df= }}</ref> he was an unused substitute in ''The Elephants''' 2–2 away draw (held on 5 March 2014) against Belgium.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.kansascity.com/2014/03/05/4867900/belgium-draws-with-ivory-coast.html|title=Belgium draws with Ivory Coast 2–2 in WCup warm-up|trans-title=|work=KansasCitySports|date=5 March 2014|accessdate=11 March 2014}}</ref> On 6 September 2015, Seri made his senior international debut in a [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations qualification Group I|2017 Africa Cup of Nations qualification match]] against [[Sierra Leone national football team|Sierra Leone]], playing the entire match in the 0–0 away draw. Seri played two of Ivory Coast's three [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations]] Group C matches. They finished third in Group C and thus did not qualify for the quarterfinals. On 17 November 2015, Seri scored a goal in the 64th minute of the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – CAF Second Round|2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]] second round second leg 3–0 home win over [[Liberia national football team|Liberia]] to register his first senior international goal.
